title.justification: This is the title of the paper as stated at the beginning of the document: "Open-Set Multivariate Time-Series Anomaly Detection"

extractions.description: This paper introduces the Multivariate Open-Set time-series Anomaly Detector (MOSAD), which is the first algorithm to address the open-set time-series anomaly detection (TSAD) problem. MOSAD utilizes a multi-head network with Generative, Discriminative, and Anomaly-Aware Contrastive heads to detect anomalies in multivariate time-series datasets. Extensive experiments demonstrate MOSAD's superior performance over existing methods.

type.justification: The paper includes extensive experimental results comparing MOSAD with other methods on various datasets, indicating an empirical study.
type.quote: Our extensive experimental results not only establishes MOSAD as the new SOTA in the field, but paves the way for improved real-world applications of anomaly detection in diverse domains.

primary_research_field.justification: The focus of the paper is on detecting anomalies in time-series data, specifically addressing the open-set anomaly detection problem.
primary_research_field.quote: This paper is the first to address the open-set TSAD problem...

sub_research_fields.justification: The paper specifically tackles anomaly detection within the context of multivariate time-series data.
sub_research_fields.quote: The main contributions of this paper are described as follows: MOSAD encompasses three primary modules: the Feature Extractor, the Multi-head Network and the Anomaly Scoring module.

name.justification: This model is the primary contribution of the paper.
name.quote: The proposed method, called Multivariate Open-Set time-series Anomaly Detector (MOSAD), is a novel multi-head framework...

caracteristics.justification: MOSAD is described as a multi-head framework consisting of Generative, Discriminative, and Anomaly-Aware Contrastive heads.
caracteristics.quote: The proposed method, called Multivariate Open-Set time-series Anomaly Detector (MOSAD), is a novel multi-head framework...

name.justification: The TCN is used as the feature extractor within the MOSAD framework.
name.quote: we utilize a temporal convolutional network (TCN) [Bai et al., 2018] as our feature extractor

caracteristics.justification: A TCN is a type of convolutional neural network designed for sequence modeling.

name.justification: An autoencoder is used in the Generative head of the MOSAD framework.
name.quote: We employ a generative approach based on the autoencoder framework that consists of an encoder and a decoder.

caracteristics.justification: The model uses an autoencoder framework specifically mentioned in the generative head.
caracteristics.quote: We employ a generative approach based on the autoencoder framework that consists of an encoder and a decoder.

name.justification: This dataset is used to evaluate the performance of the MOSAD model.
name.quote: SMD is a 5-week-long dataset collected from different machines in a large Internet company with anomalies that are annotated by domain experts.

name.justification: This dataset is used to evaluate the performance of the MOSAD model.
name.quote: PTB-XL is a large electrocardiography (ECG) dataset comprising of normal and pathological heart rhythms...

name.value: Temple University Hospital Electroencephalogram Seizure Corpus (TUSZ)
name.justification: This dataset is used to evaluate the performance of the MOSAD model.
name.quote: TUSZ is the largest electroencephalogram (EEG) database, with normal data representing brain activity in resting-states and abnormal data representing seizures.
